name: Data Pipeline
desc: An arbitrarily complex chain of processes that manipulate data where the output data of one process becomes the input to the next.

name: Computational Complexity
desc: The amount of resources required for running an algorithm.

name: Scalability
desc: The capability of a system, network, or process to handle a growing amount of work.

name: Performance Testing
desc: A type of software testing to ensure software applications will perform well under their expected workload.

name: Continuous Integration
desc: A software development practice whereby developers combine changes to the code in a central repository on a regular basis, after which automatic versions and tests are executed.

name: Algorithmic efficiency
desc: Number of computational resources (computational time, the memory space, etc) used by the algorithm.

name: Proof of Concept
desc: A realization of a certain method or idea in order to demonstrate its feasibility.

name: Software quality
desc: Software quality is defined as a field of study and practice that describes the desirable attributes of software products. There are two main approaches to software quality: defect management and quality attributes.

name: Release
desc: A distribution of a computer software in the sum of the stages of development and maturity for a piece of computer software.
